Microsoft-Academic.title: gas fraction and depletion time of massive star forming galaxies at z 3 2 no change in global star formation process out to z 3

ANDS-Grants.description: Over the last 10 billion years the star formation rate in galaxies has been decreasing. Yet it is not known whether this is driven by a decline in the accretion of the gas that forms stars or stronger stellar feedback-driven gas outflows. The gradient in elemental abundances with galactic radius can constrain these two processes. I propose to calibrate the measurement of this quantity using nearby galaxies, and measure the gradients in a low-z sample of galaxies using Australian telescopes. These will be compared with theoretical models to determine the process that is driving the Universe to be more quiescent over cosmic time.
ANDS-Grants.title: Future Fellowships - Grant ID: FT140101202
subjects: GALAXIES: EVOLUTION; GALAXIES: INTERSTELLAR MEDIUM; INTEGRAL FIELD SPECTROSCOPY

ANDS-Grants.description: This project aims to complete a revolutionary new instrument, Hector-1 to be installed on the Anglo-Australian Telescope. Hector-1 builds on the highly successful SAMI instrument with new, larger, 3-D spectroscopic-imaging optical fibre bundles and the highest resolution spectrographs of any instrument of its type in the world. Hector-1 will enable the largest ever survey of nearby galaxies in 3-D. The Hector-1 data will be able to trace the kinematics of gas and stars as well as mapping ionisation mechanisms across 15,000 galaxies. Major breakthroughs are expected in understanding how the environment affects how galaxies evolve to have the broad-ranging physical properties seen in the local Universe.
ANDS-Grants.title: Linkage Infrastructure, Equipment and Facilities - Grant ID: LE190100018
